title: DIY and Decorating Ideas for a Santa Inspired Foyer Display

excerpt: Decorating ideas for an inspired Santa-themed entryway. I pulled together a fun Christmas Santa display for our foyer this year a...
text: December 04, 2024 Share this Decorating ideas for an inspired Santa-themed entryway. I pulled together a fun Christmas Santa display for our foyer this year and absolutely love how it turned out!Â  In general, tabletop and bookcase decorating are the hardest for me to get right. I find it much easier to decorated smaller spots, especially for the holidays.Â  Usually I'm overwhelmed by all of the display space our long Everett entryway table has. Last year I just lined up our cute lighted village: And it was very pretty! But I wanted to do something a little more Christmasy this time.Â  This year I decided to place theÂ DIY wood "believe" sign I made a few years ago on the bottom shelf.Â  Each letter is individual and I made them to stand up, so I spread them out along the bottom and then added some small decor accents like greenery and pinecones:Â  It was after I got these letters set up that this theme came to me -- I wanted to do a "Believe in Santa" inspired display.Â  I had so much fun pulling this together! On a recent antiquing trip, I found these big brass bells that I laid throughout the greenery:Â  This post may containÂ affiliate links for yourÂ convenience. I may earn a small commission whenÂ you make a purchase through links.Â  I was looking specifically for a standing brass bell to use in the display, and was thrilled when I came across one while antiquing as well:Â  I know some like the worn, antiqued look of brass, but I prefer to clean it up and give it some shine! I used my favorite brass cleaning method and it turned out absolutely beautiful!: I imagine Santa's bell would be bright and shiny, right? :)Â  You can find tons of inexpensive and beautiful holiday themed art on Etsy -- this image of Santa reading is what I printed out for this display.Â  If you have a great printer, you could easily print this at home.Â  I print mine at CVS for a few bucks -- they always have coupon codes for discounts too! That black tabletop easelÂ the Santa print sits in is one of my favorite decor pieces -- it's so versatile and looks great anywhere I put it.Â  We've had this cute Letters to Santa display box for years, and it came in a metallic bronze tone:Â  It just wasn't hitting right for me in that color, so I gave it a little makeover with some black spray paint:Â  I liked the brass knob, so I kept it as it was.Â  The box needed some dimension, so I grabbed my gold Rub n Buff and used it to highlight the letters:Â  What a difference it made! I absolutely love it now.Â  How could I create a Santa display without including my own letter to Santa? The experience of finding my own letter to Santa Claus in a book (more than 30 year later) was super special: I highly recommend that book for yourself or as a gift. It includes hundreds ofÂ letters sent to the town of Santa ClausÂ (right here in Indiana), from each decade as far back as the 1930's.Â  It is now one of my most treasured pieces! Months ago I saw a gorgeous rattan sleigh online (I found mine at Antique Farmhouse), and thought it was such a unique find.Â  I ordered it and then everywhere I looked there were wicker sleighs. Haha! This is an ongoing occurrence with my Christmas decor this year. ;) They are very popular this season, for good reason.Â  Ours is loaded up with a couple of the pretty Christmas decor finds I shared a few weeks ago. I used the soft, flowy greenery from that post, and then nestled in some of the wood and brass bells:Â  If you're looking for a larger sleigh like this, I found this natural rattan sleigh that is a little more rustic but looks to be a similar size.Â  It all came together so beautifully! We love this sweet Christmas display:Â  Oh, I forgot about the cute Santa boots! It got a little busy to include those on the table, but they look great on the floor too:Â  I also had one my husband's old pipes propped on the stack of books, but it was getting lost on the display. I needed to reel it in a little anyway. ðŸ˜‚ I'm so happy with how this Santa set up came together! I don't usually do themed decor, but it's definitely my favorite Christmas decor ever: Do you have a theme to your holiday decor?Â  Share this
html:
December 04, 2024

Share this

Decorating ideas for an inspired Santa-themed entryway.

I pulled together a fun Christmas Santa display for our foyer this year and absolutely love how it turned out!Â 

In general, tabletop and bookcase decorating are the hardest for me to get right. I find it much easier to decorated smaller spots, especially for the holidays.Â 

Usually I'm overwhelmed by all of the display space our long Everett entryway table has. Last year I just lined up our cute lighted village:

And it was very pretty! But I wanted to do something a little more Christmasy this time.Â 

This year I decided to place theÂ DIY wood "believe" sign I made a few years ago on the bottom shelf.Â 

Each letter is individual and I made them to stand up, so I spread them out along the bottom and then added some small decor accents like greenery and pinecones:Â 

It was after I got these letters set up that this theme came to me -- I wanted to do a "Believe in Santa" inspired display.Â 

I had so much fun pulling this together!

On a recent antiquing trip, I found these big brass bells that I laid throughout the greenery:Â 

This post may containÂ affiliate links for yourÂ convenience.

I may earn a small commission whenÂ you make a purchase through links.Â 

I was looking specifically for a standing brass bell to use in the display, and was thrilled when I came across one while antiquing as well:Â 

I know some like the worn, antiqued look of brass, but I prefer to clean it up and give it some shine! I used my favorite brass cleaning method and it turned out absolutely beautiful!:

I imagine Santa's bell would be bright and shiny, right? :)Â 

You can find tons of inexpensive and beautiful holiday themed art on Etsy -- this image of Santa reading is what I printed out for this display.Â 

If you have a great printer, you could easily print this at home.Â 

I print mine at CVS for a few bucks -- they always have coupon codes for discounts too!

That black tabletop easelÂ the Santa print sits in is one of my favorite decor pieces -- it's so versatile and looks great anywhere I put it.Â 

We've had this cute Letters to Santa display box for years, and it came in a metallic bronze tone:Â 

It just wasn't hitting right for me in that color, so I gave it a little makeover with some black spray paint:Â 

I liked the brass knob, so I kept it as it was.Â 

The box needed some dimension, so I grabbed my gold Rub n Buff and used it to highlight the letters:Â 

What a difference it made! I absolutely love it now.Â 

How could I create a Santa display without including my own letter to Santa? The experience of finding my own letter to Santa Claus in a book (more than 30 year later) was super special:

I highly recommend that book for yourself or as a gift. It includes hundreds ofÂ letters sent to the town of Santa ClausÂ (right here in Indiana), from each decade as far back as the 1930's.Â 

It is now one of my most treasured pieces!

Months ago I saw a gorgeous rattan sleigh online (I found mine at Antique Farmhouse), and thought it was such a unique find.Â 

I ordered it and then everywhere I looked there were wicker sleighs. Haha! This is an ongoing occurrence with my Christmas decor this year. ;) They are very popular this season, for good reason.Â 

Ours is loaded up with a couple of the pretty Christmas decor finds I shared a few weeks ago. I used the soft, flowy greenery from that post, and then nestled in some of the wood and brass bells:Â 

If you're looking for a larger sleigh like this, I found this natural rattan sleigh that is a little more rustic but looks to be a similar size.Â 

It all came together so beautifully! We love this sweet Christmas display:Â 

Oh, I forgot about the cute Santa boots! It got a little busy to include those on the table, but they look great on the floor too:Â 

I also had one my husband's old pipes propped on the stack of books, but it was getting lost on the display. I needed to reel it in a little anyway. ðŸ˜‚

I'm so happy with how this Santa set up came together! I don't usually do themed decor, but it's definitely my favorite Christmas decor ever:

Do you have a theme to your holiday decor?Â 

Share this
